pr_title: [JBPM-9015] KIE-Server rendererd forms bind data to incorrect process variable names

timeline.bodyText:
could we use this org.kie.server.services.jbpm.ui.form.render.model.FormInstance.getNestedForm(String) instead here?
meaning topLevelForm..getNestedForm(form.getId())
timeline.author: mswiderski

replies.bodyText:
I am lost with this comment.
fieldForm.getNestedForm().equals(form.getId()) is not equivalent to
topLevelForm..getNestedForm(form.getId())
what exactly you want to change ?
replies.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText: wouldn't getNestedForm return the form or null for given formId? U mean to replace the entire stream, filter, etc
replies.author: mswiderski

replies.bodyText: The idea is to find the binding in the top level form. Each field has the nested form id that belongs to (AFAIK)
replies.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText: there should be a resolver that can look through all children forms so might be able to find any that is defined for the top level one
replies.author: mswiderski

timeline.bodyText: this would be ideal to be already added to the FormModel class next to classname and name. Have you looked if this can be achieved?
timeline.author: mswiderski

replies.bodyText: The problem is that FormModel is "clean" in the sense that the binding is introduced in the top level form and not here so you only have local information. Those comes from unmarshalling files.
replies.author: elguardian

timeline.message:
[JBPM-9015] KIE-Server rendererd forms bind data to incorrect process variable names

Associate the model with the top nested form field binding name

[JBPM-9015] KIE-Server rendererd forms bind data to incorrect process variable names

Associate the model with the top nested form field binding name
